author: Casey Quackenbush
title: Fancy Year of the Dog Swag for 2018 Chinese New Year
text:
Chinese New Year, China‚Äôs biggest holiday, kicks off on Feb. 16, and luxury brands are seizing the opportunity to cash in on the spending power of Chinese consumers.
This year, Ministry of Commerce figures predict that total retail and catering sales will hit 900 billion yuan ($143 billion), according to the Asia Times .
With the Year of the Dog fast approaching, retailers are vying to catch the eyes (and wallets) of Chinese New Year shoppers during the public holiday. As such, brands have rolled out their own limited-edition merchandise in celebration of the Chinese New Year.
Gucci Gucci has designed a special purse for the holiday. At $3,290, the Chinese New Year Dionysus shoulder bag comes in hibiscus red leather intricately engraved with gold flowers and closes with a tiger head clasp.
#Gucci NWT $3290 Red Gold Leather Chinese New Year "Dionysus" Shoulder #kokobop https://t.co/g5KWxwdJnB pic.twitter.com/bt3e2pnYBZ
‚Äî Soulmate Bag (@SoulmateBag) July 15, 2017
Vacheron Constantin
Ever year, Vacheron Constantin designs a new watch for Chinese New Year. In honor of the Year of the Dog, a chiseled canine adorns this year‚Äôs 40-millimeter timepiece that comes in platinum or rose gold. The former has a blue dial with a white gold dog, while the latter has a pink gold dog on a bronze dial. The Swiss company is selling just 12 of both models for $125,000 each.
$125,000 'Year Of The Dog' Watch Unveiled by Vacheron Constantin For Chinese New Year: The oldest continually @ https://t.co/Y9QKcMvRO7 pic.twitter.com/ldWE6q9Uda
‚Äî GJB Partners (@gjbpartners) October 11, 2017
Chopard
In a special edition Chopard watch, the Swiss watchmaker depicts a dog of Asian ‚ÄòAkita‚Äô breed on a dial made with traditional Japanese lacquering techniques. The 18-karat rose gold watch goes for $24,500.
Chopard L.U.C. Urushi Year of The Dog #chopard ##lucurushiyearofthedog #chopardlucurushiyearofthedog #AutomaticWatch; #Chronograph, #Chronometer, #CollectibleWatch, #CollectibleWatches, #ExpensiveWatch, #HeirloomChronometer, #HeirloomTimepiece, #HeirloomTimepieces, #Heirloom #Tourbillon, #LuxuryTourbillon, #HeirloomWatch, #HeirloomWatches, #LuxuryChronograph, #LuxuryChronometer, #LuxuryTimepieces, #LuxuryWatches, #RegulatorWatch, #SkeletonWatch, #SwissWatch, #SwissWatches, #Timepieces, #timepiece, #Tourbillon, #Watches, #horologigrafica #watchesofinstagram All photos copyright ¬© their respective owners.
A post shared by John Loves Watches (@horologigrafica) on Nov 19, 2017 at 7:43pm PST
Dolce & Gabbana Dolce & Gabbana already has a thing for dogs, so in honor of the Year of the Dog, the Italian fashion house unveiled an entire collection of clothes, bags, and accessories for women, men, and children.
Begin the Chinese New Year with some festive cheer. Discover the Dolce&Gabbana collection: here to get your wardrobe in gear! #DGLovesChina #DGFamily #CNY2018 #DGCNYGIFTS #DGMen #DGWomen
A post shared by Dolce & Gabbana (@dolcegabbana) on Jan 30, 2018 at 4:00am PST
Adidas Adidas (addyy) released a set of four red-and-white sneakers with the heel of each pair embellished with a different traditional New Year blessings in Chinese characters: ‚ÄúFU‚Äù (luck), ‚ÄúLU‚Äù (wealth), ‚ÄúSHOU‚Äù (longevity), and ‚ÄúXI‚Äù (happiness).
Celebrating Chinese New Year, we announce the CNY Pack. Featuring the #NMD R2 and #EQT Support ADV, the pack arrives January 13th.
A post shared by adidas Originals (@adidasoriginals) on Jan 5, 2018 at 1:05am PST
Nike Nike (nke) put a Lunar New Year spin on its signature Air Jordans . The black sneaker is fashioned with fireworks, red and white flower embroidery, and Chinese lettering on the heel. There‚Äôs a version in its retro model , and even a pair for kids . The kicks hit the stands on Feb. 9 for $200.
The @Jumpman23 Air Jordan XXXII 'Chinese New Year'
Shop üá∫üá∏ https://t.co/KNk0gvuqKw pic.twitter.com/lgDTRsBjKp
‚Äî Nike.com (@nikestore) February 9, 2018
The Remade
Sneaker brand The Remade takes flashy footwear to the next level with its custom Nike Air More Uptempos . Cast in Italian red leather with copper lace buckles, the popular 90‚Äôs model is emblazoned with ‚ÄúCN¬•‚Äù‚Äîa Chinese yuan sign in lieu of a Y‚Äîand China‚Äôs Five Star symbol on the heels. Both embellishments transform to a golden gradient when exposed to heat.
Temperature changing materials on the letters CNY. Y is designed like the Chinese Yuan. More info on TheRemade.com #cny #theremade #nike #uptempo #airuptempo
A post shared by The Remade (@theremade) on Dec 28, 2017 at 5:29am PST
Sankuanz x Vans In partnership with Chinese label Sankuanz, Vans also unveiled its collection ‚Äú REBEL TEETH | DO NOT PET ME I AM AGGRESSIVE .‚Äù The Year of the Dog collection includes a set of four sneakers and six pieces of apparel, and was inspired by ‚Äúthe attitude of a mad dog.‚Äù
VANS X SANKUANZ To celebrate the Chinese Lunar New Year, Vans partners with renowned designer SANKUANZ and his apparel brand to design an exclusive collection of footwear and apparel for the Year of the Dog. The SANKUANZ x VANS Year of the Dog zodiac collection 4 footwear silhouettes at Robinsons the Heeren from Friday, 12 January 2018. #yearofthedog
A post shared by Robinsons Singapore (@robinsonssg) on Jan 9, 2018 at 8:06pm PST
Bape Similarly, Japanese streetwear brand Bape has released a line of graphic tees, sweatshirts, and hoodies printed with a dog alongside its iconic Ape head.
Bape celebrates Chinese New Year with "Year of the Dog" collection. https://t.co/zZSVnHxgod pic.twitter.com/BFQjk6plFv
‚Äî Complex Style (@ComplexStyle) December 26, 2017
